ai.summary: GM Ringway Stage 4 is a demanding 22.8 km section of the GM Ringway long-distance path in the UK. This hard-stage hike combines varied terrain, steady climbs, and exposed sections, typically taking a full day for many hikers. It’s best attempted by experienced walkers with solid navigation, good physical conditioning, and careful planning for weather and daylight.
ai.terrain_summary: Varied terrain including grassy moorland and heather, woodland trails, and occasional exposed paths. Expect uneven footing, boggy or wet sections after rain, rocky steps, and noticeable ascents and descents. Navigation is important, as some waymarkers may be sparse; bring a map and compass or a GPS device.
ai.safety_notes: Hard 22.8 km trek in a region with variable weather; plan for UK conditions. Wear sturdy waterproof boots and layered, weather‑proof clothing. Carry adequate water and high‑energy food, plus a basic first‑aid kit. Bring a map and compass (or GPS), a charged phone, and a whistle. Tell someone your route and expected return time. Check forecasts, daylight hours, and potential closures; in exposed or remote sections, consider turning back if conditions deteriorate.
recommended_gear: Sturdy waterproof hiking boots with good ankle support
Map and compass (and/or GPS device) with charged battery
Headlamp or handheld flashlight with extra batteries
Water bottle or hydration system (2–3 liters total if hot or strenuous)
High-energy snacks and a small meal
Emergency whistle and space blanket or bivy
Trekking poles (recommended for long ascents and rough terrain)
Rain cover for your backpack and spare socks
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March–October) are generally best for Stage 4 in the UK; winter hikes are possible but require advanced planning, shorter daylight, and more technical conditions.

seo.title: GM Ringway Stage 4 – 22.8 km Hard Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover GM Ringway Stage 4, a challenging 22.8 km route in the UK. Learn about terrain, safety tips, and essential gear for this hard long-distance hike.
